question:
(a) What are the similarities and differences between the lines of latitude and longitude?

(b) An international cricket match between The Gambia and India is scheduled to start in Banjul (longitude 16°W) at 9.00a.m local time on 26th June. Calculate the time and day that listeners will have to tune to their radios for the start of the commentary at (i) Bombay (74°E) (ii) Pittsburg (89°W).
answer:
Similarities between the lines of latitude and longitude:

(i) Both latitude and longitude are used to locate position of places

(ii) Both are measured in degrees

(iii) Both are angular distance of a point on the earth's surf

Lines of Latitudes Lines of longitude

(I) Lines of latitude run from West to East between one place to another.
(ii) Lines of latitude are used to calculate distance between one place to another
(iii) Lines of latitude cannot be used to calculate local time.
(iv) The latitudinal extent of the globe is from 90°N and 90°S 

- Lines of longitude run from North to South between one place and another.
- Lines of longitude cannot be used to calculate distance between one place and another
- Lines of longitude are used in calculating local time.
- The longitudinal extent of the globe is from 180° E to 180°W 

(b)(i) Bombay (74°E)
(a) Find the longitude differences between Banjul and Bombay = (16°W and 74°E) = 74°E + 16°W = 90°
(b) Convert 90° to time. Note 15° = 1 hour
15°      6hrs
90° =   6 hours

(c) Since Bombay is east of Banjul, the 6 hours are added to the 9.00am. i.e 9.00am + 6 hours = 3.00p.m the day i.e 26th June. The listeners in Bombay will listen to commentary at 3.00pm on 26/6

(b) (ii) Pittsburg (80°W) 
(a) Find the longitude difference between Banjul and Pittsburg = (80°W - 16°W) = 64°
(b) Convert 65° to time. Note 15° = 1 hr
15       4 hrs
          64
          60
       4° x 4 mins = 16 minutes
Time difference = 4hrs 16 minutes

(c) Since Pittsburg is West of Banjul, the 4 hrs 16 mins are subtracted from 9.00a.m
i.e 9.00a.m - 4hrs 16 mins = 9.00
                                              4.16
                                              4.44 hours
The time and date listeners in Pittsburg will listen to the commentary is 4.44am the same day 26th June.

question:
(a) Describe the characteristics of any two of the following types of landforms
(i) delta
(ii) atoll
(iii) caldera

(b) Explain with the aid of diagrams the mode of formation of each of the landforms you have chosen
answer:
(a)(i) The characteristics of a delta include:

(i) The branching of rivers into channels called distributaries

(ii) Large deposits of weathered materials

(iii) It is formed at the mouth of rivers

(iv) It takes up the shape of a fan

(b) The r of formation of a delta is influenced by the following factors; 

(i) Active vertical and lateral erosion in the upper course of the river to provide extensive sediments to be deposited as deltas

(ii) The coast should be sheltered or tic',

(iii) The sea adjoining the delta should be shallow or else the load will disappear in the deep waters

(iv), Absence of lakes in the river course to filter off the sediments

(v) Absence of strong current running at right angles to the mouth so as not to wash away sediments 

(b)(i) Characteristics of caldera:

(i) It is formed from volcanic activities

(ii) It is a depression on volcano cones with steep sides

(iii) Depression of magma gives rise to caldera

(iv) It may contain water called caldera lake. Caldera is formed when composite volcano explodes violently, its top is blown off and disintegrates into a mass of rocks and ashes, leaving the crater greatly enlarged. The huge crater-like depression is coiled caldera. It can also be formed through subsidence. The depression may result in accumulation of water to form caldera lake

question:
(a) With the aid of appropriate diagrams, describe the distinguishing characteristics of any three types of urban settlements

(b) Discs any four problems of urbanization
answer:
Three types of urban settlement include:
(i) Cities
(ii) Conurbation
(iii) Megalopolis

(i) City: A city is made up of large towns with great( number of people and services. In a city there are towns which combined together to function as one

(ii) Conurbation: Is made up of two or more towns join E together through growth but which may still retain thE identities. These two towns are separated from eac other but through expansion or growth have joined together. But despite this, they still retain their identities

(iii) Megalopolis: This is the largest of tl-urban settlements and includes the joining of man cities to form an extensive urban area. 

(b) Four problems of urbanization include:

(i) Inadequate transport facilities. Increase in the number of people in the urban area often leads to problem of transportation

(ii) Overuse and deterioration of available social services. Most of the social services available,. e.g electricity, stadium, school, hospital are overused and this leads to their deterioration

(iii) There is an aggravated problem of unemployment and underemployment in the cities as well as reduce labour force in the rural areas

(iv) There is the problem of undue increase in human and vehicular traffic.

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria locate and name:
(i) one important sea port and one important river port
(ii) The road or railway serving each of the ports in (i) above
(iii) one international airport and one domestic airport

(b) What four factors have helped the development of any one of the ports?

(c) What two factors have limited the use of any one of the ports?
answer:
(b) Four factors which have helped in the development of Apapa (Lagos) port; 

(i)Apapa port handles the bulk of the country's export and imports

(ii) Apapa port is the focus of many different types of routes e.g sea routes from Europe

(iii) it is served by good roads and railway network

(iv) Apapa port is located on a very good harbour.

(c) Two factors that have limited the use of Apapa port are:

(i) Congestion of both importer: and exportable goods

(ii) Drifting of sand and waves into the harbour.

question:
(a) Draw a sketch map of Nigeria to show any three vegetation belts.

(b) Describe the effects of climate on the vegetation of any one of the belts

(c) Name any two resources found in the vegetation belt shown in (a) above and describe any two uses of each.
answer:
(b) Effects of climate on the rainforest belt:

(i) High rainfall the year round makes the vegetation to be evergreen

(ii) High temperature also contributes to the vegetative growth of plants

(iii) Abundance of sunshine and high relative humidity also contribute to the luxuriant growth cf forest trees.

(c) Two resources found in rainforests are:

(i) Timber
- Used in the construction of houses and furniture
-Timber can also be used as fuel wood 

(ii) Wild animals
- Used as food, e.g bush meat
- Serves as game

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Nigeria, mark and name the following
(i) the Western Uplands, the Udi Hills and the North Central Plateau
(ii) one important river basin
(iii) one natural lake and one man-made lake

(b) Explain with specific examples the importance of river basin in the development of Nigeria

(c) What three factors are limiting the use of river basins in Nigeria?
answer:
(b) Importance of river basins in the development of Nigeria;

(i) Most of the river basins serve as fertile ground for the cultivation of many crops e.g Chad basin

(ii) Basins being lowland are good sites for human habitation i.e settlement

(iii) Some water bodies in these basins are used for irrigation purposes

(c) Three factors limiting the use of river basins; 

(i) Swampy nature of the area

(ii) Inaccessibility of the area

(iii) Seasonality of some of the rivers.

question:
(a) Draw an outline map of Nigeria and on it show and name:
(i) one area each for oil palm, cotton and cocoa cultivation
(ii) one forest belt and one savanna belt

(b) Explain any four ways in which any one of the crops named in (a) above is important to the economy of Nigeria

(c) What three problems does the cultivation of the crops named in (b) above face?
answer:
(b) Four ways in which cocoa is important to me economy of Nigeria

(i) Cocoa provides foreign exchange for the country

(ii) It is used in making beverages e.g, Bournvita

(iii) It provides raw materials, e.g cocoa for industries

(iv) It also provides employments to some people involved in cocoa production

(c) There problems facing the cultivation of cocoa

(i) The problem of pests and diseases

(ii) Poor processing of cocoa beans

(iii) Poor quality of cocoa species, some are low yielding.

question:
(a) On an outline map of West Africa show and name:
(i) two countries important for the production of rubber
(ii) one important town in the rubber producing area in each country
(iii) two countries important for the production of groundnuts
(iv) one important town in the groundnut producing area in each country

(b) Describe the process of production of either rubber or groundnuts, in the country shown on your map

(c) Explain any three factors which hinder the large scale production of either rubber or groundnuts in WestAfrica.
answer:
(b) Rubber is produced or extracted from the tre( a process called tapping. Early in the morning  rubber farmer goes to tap his rubber trees by making a cut on them. Below each cut he places a cup it which the milky juice caked latex drips. This is collected in pails in the evening. The latex is mixed with certain chemicals which make it to coagulate. it is rolled into sheets and smoked to a brown colt and are later sold to local buying agents.

(c) Three problems which may hinder the large scale production of rubber include:

(i) It takes the rubber trees long to mature - about 6 to 8 years

(ii) Presence of poor quality or low yielding varieties of rubber

(iii) Pests diseases attack on rubber also reduces the yield

question:
